page.title: 05HARMBY- A FARMER'S DAY
page.content: I BEGIN AT 5.45 AM. BY BRINGING IN AND MILKING OUR 105 FRIESIAN COWS. THIS TAKES UNTIL 8.00 AM. WHEN THE MILK TANKER CALLS TO TAKE THE MILK TO THE DAIRY.OUR FARM WORKER COMES AT 8.00 AM. AND FEEDS THE CALVES. AFTER BREAKFAST I WASH THE MILKING EQUIPMENT AND MAKE BUSINESS TELEPHONE CALLS. I THEN WALK ROUND THE SHEEP AND CHECK THAT THEY ARE ALL WELL.WE THEN LOAD THE TRACTOR AND TRAILER WITH NEW FENCE POSTS,RAILS & WIRE TO MEND BROKEN FENCES OR DO OTHER SUCH JOBS. AFTER LUNCH THE FARM WORKER FINISHES THE FENCING AND I TAKE ANOTHER TRACTOR AND A LOAD OF ARTIFICIAL FERTILIZER ON TO THE FIELDS WHERE GRASS HAS BEEN TAKEN FOR SILAGE RECENTLY. AT 3.45 PM.I BRING IN AND MILK THE COWS AGAIN.THE FARM WORKER FEEDS THE CALVES.I FINISH WORK ABOUT 6.15 PM BY MR D.FORD
